tutorial_pages.title: Fundamentals of Pickleball
tutorial_pages.content_html:
Fundamentals of Pickleball

Tutorial Focus: Serving, Scoring, and Positioning

tutorial_pages.title: Before You Begin
tutorial_pages.content_html:
Before You Begin

  1. Decide which team is going to serve first.
  2. Decide which team member is going to serve first.

tutorial_pages.title: Scoring in Pickleball
tutorial_pages.content_html:
Scoring in Pickleball

  1. Scoring (only serving team can score).
  2. Each team has two serves (both players on the team).

tutorial_pages.title: Serving Basics
tutorial_pages.content_html:
Serving Basics

  1. Server stands behind baseline.
  2. Only at the beginning, server must serve from the right side of the court.

tutorial_pages.title: Serving Basics Part 2
tutorial_pages.content_html:
Serving Basics Part 2

  1. Server makes a diagonal serve.
  2. It must clear the net and land in opponent’s correct service court.

tutorial_pages.title: Double Bounce Rule
tutorial_pages.content_html:
Double Bounce Rule

After the serve, the receiving team must let the ball bounce once before returning.

tutorial_pages.title: Double Bounce Rule Part 2
tutorial_pages.content_html:
Double Bounce Rule Part 2

Then the serving team must also let that return bounce once before hitting it.

Example Scenario: Serve → bounce → return → bounce → volley permitted. No volleys are allowed until after these two bounces.

Volley – hit the ball while it’s in the air before it has bounced.

tutorial_pages.title: GAME ON!
tutorial_pages.content_html:
GAME ON!

Now, you can let the ball bounce once and then hit it OR just volley.

Volley – hit the ball while it’s in the air before it has bounced.

tutorial_pages.title: Scoring: Serving Side Fault (lose)
tutorial_pages.content_html:
Scoring: Serving Side Fault (lose)

Ball Error
  1. Hit the ball into the net and it fails to clear.
  2. Hit the ball out of bounds (beyond any sideline or baseline).
  3. Ball bouncing twice on your side before returning it (only one bounce allowed).
  4. Strike the ball twice or carry instead of a clean hit.
Server Fault
  1. Serve lands outside the correct diagonal service court.
  2. Double-bounce rule violation.
  3. Volley (third shot) before it bounces.


Result
  1. No score.
  2. Next teammate serves (no switching sides here).

tutorial_pages.title: Scoring: Serving Side Win
tutorial_pages.content_html:
Scoring: Serving Side Win

Opponent Ball Errors
  1. Opponent hits the ball into the net and it fails to clear.
  2. Opponent hits the ball out of bounds (beyond any sideline or baseline).
  3. Opponent lets the ball bounce twice on their side.
  4. Opponent makes an illegal double hit, carry, or catch/throw.
Opponent Double-Bounce Violations
  1. Opponent volleys the serve return before it bounces on their side.
  2. Double-bounce rule violation on subsequent shots.
  3. Volley (third shot) before it bounces.

Result
  1. Serving side gets a score.
  2. Person serving must switch sides with teammate after every point.

tutorial_pages.title: What Happens Next?
tutorial_pages.content_html:
What Happens Next?

  1. Serve switches to opposition.
  2. Once both teammates have served and faulted (lost), the serve goes to the opposition.

tutorial_pages.title: Non-Volley Zone or The Kitchen
tutorial_pages.content_html:
Non-Volley Zone or The Kitchen

Rules for the zone:

  1. If the ball is in this zone, you MUST let it bounce once before hitting it.
  2. You cannot volley while any part of your feet is in the zone.

Volley – hit the ball while it’s in the air before it has bounced.
